intro: Fissistigma kwangsiense, commonly known as the Guangxi fissistigma, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited distribution due to habitat specificity. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species.
